newsitem.title: JAPAN: LME copper may breach $2,000/tonne in Sept - M'bishi.
newsitem.headline: LME copper may breach $2,000/tonne in Sept - M'bishi.

text.p: Tight supplies of copper scrap and options-related covering could help push London Metal Exchange copper prices into the $2,000 to $2,100 a tonne range in September, Mitsubishi Corp said in its latest monthly report on the copper market.

"In the short term the market outlook will remain focused on the recent $1,920 to $1,970 trading range, but from September onward we expect a firm market that targets $2,000 to $2,100," the report said.
The report, dated August 19, said that continued tightness in the scrap market since mid-June may prompt renewed cathode buying from the United States and Asia in lieu of scrap.
The continued backwardation was also seen fuelling impressions of market tightness, while stop-loss buying was likely to propel prices further upward if resistance is breached at $1,970 a tonne.
The report also noted, however, that talk that China was holding 100,000 tonnes of copper in Shanghai warehouses was weighing on market sentiment.
